intro: Cyrtopera papuana, commonly known as the Papuan cyrtopera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of red and purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
